intro: Anemone pseudoaltaica f. hanagasa, commonly known as the Japanese anemone or Hanagasa anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, moist soils in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
